RumorFact.Text: The Orbital Probe Cannon detected an unknown body within the solar system that was a partial match for the Eye of the Universe.

ExploreFact.Text: An invisible structure far below the plane of the solar system.
I passed through a strange device and the structure revealed itself. I can see ghost matter now! Symbols are chalked on the floor under the device that read: <Color=#ff0040>-;[} )&]&</Color>
The structure is composed of the same material as ghost matter crystals.

RumorFact.Text: There is an entrance to the structure on the sunward side.

ExploreFact.Text: A sphere of water orbits inside the structure.
There is an unknown signal coming from an antenna within the structure. It's completely surrounded by ghost matter.
There is an antenna broadcasting a chiming signal within the structure.

There are 23 tally marks displayed next to an indicator light on the floor. The final mark is only one-sixth full. Symbols are chalked next to a device nearby that read: <Color=#ff0040>+?+.|;}[?/</Color>
After passing through the strange device a second time, I can see green trails emanating from the nearby device connected to points throughout the solar system.
The final mark powered on and the indicator light turned green when Self was present in the solar system.
There are 6 icons displayed next to an indicator light on the floor. One of the icons is powered off. Symbols are chalked next to a device nearby that read: <Color=#ff0040>{+;*&*];(}</Color>
After passing through the strange device a second time, I can see purple trails emanating from the nearby device connected to points throughout the solar system.
All of the icons powered on and the indicator light turned green when a spacecraft was present on each planet in the solar system.
There is a large circular icon displayed next to an indicator light on the floor. Symbols are chalked nearby that read: <Color=#ff0040>/? {./</Color>
The icon powered off and the indicator light turned green when the interior of Dark Bramble was blocking the light from the Sun.
There is strange massive device at the center of the lower deck. It appears to be unpowered. Wires run to it from three other devices nearby.

RumorFact.Text: A piece of the structure has broken off and is missing. A computer log states that a fuel seed has ruptured and blanketed the system.

ExploreFact.Text: I found a crystalline recorder in the core of The Interloper recorded by someone called Scientist. It describes liquid being used to neutralize ghost matter along with a warning about the impending rupture. The recorder describes a possible breach as being worth the risk in order to transmit something.

RumorFact.Text: A codex containing information recorded by people named Explorer, Scientist, and Archivist.
A codex containing information recorded by people named Explorer, Scientist, and Archivist.

ExploreFact.Text: REPLACE EVERYTHING BELOW THIS <Color=#00ffbc>codex downloading codex downloaded onto all connected devices translation beginning My species and my world are gone. But I have reached the Eye and that gives me hope that my people may be remembered. The Chime is ready. The light from the death of the final star has reached my receptors and I am prepared for the final journey of this universe. You now hold the Astral Codex, the sum of all knowledge my species has recorded and preserved throughout our lifetime. But your own time of ending is close at hand. Before you retire to oblivion, I humbly request: add your knowledge to the Codex and pass it onward. Send whatever device you possess on a final journey through the Eye, that the Codex may persist, and grow, and inform the worthy species in the next cycle of what came before. Remember us.</Color>

Addendum by: The Hatchling The Nomai are true scholars, always curious about the nature of our universe. Their advanced technology is spread throughout the galaxy and one clan's generations-long search for the Eye has had a profound role in the final days of this universe.
I am a Hearthian. A young species but the bravest I know. We play music and roast marshmallows with friends around a campfire. And we do not fear death! (except maybe Riebeck)

AltText.Text:
Addendum by: The Hatchling The Strangers were archivists, preserving information at any cost. But their fear of the Eye led them to hide from the world inside a simulation of their own creation. Until a single individual released the signal for the Nomai to find, and was imprisoned for their actions.
The Nomai are true scholars, always curious about the nature of our universe. Their advanced technology is spread throughout the galaxy and one clan's generations-long search for the Eye has had a profound role in the final days of this universe.
